document:
#class ofAbstractHasPixels

<!-- visible: True advanced: True istemplated: False _extends: _ -->

##InlineDescription

An abstract class representing an object that has pixels.

This empty class primarily exists to allow templated subclasses of different types to be stored as raw or shared pointers in collections such as std::vector.

Example: \code{.cpp}

std::vector<ofAbstractHasPixels> pixelProviders;

ofPixels pixels; ofFloatPixels floatPixels; ofShortPixels shortPixels;

// ...

pixelProviders.push_back(&pixels); pixelProviders.push_back(&floatPixels); pixelProviders.push_back(&shortPixels);

\endcode

##Description
